etymologies: early 16th century (in an earlier sense). From translate + -ory

definitions: Characterized by, involving, or performing translation or transference from one language, form, person, etc., to another.
Of or relating to movement from one place to another. Somewhat rare.

Designating (an instance of) motion consisting solely of movement from one place or point to another, without rotation, oscillation, etc.; (also) of or relating to motion of this kind; producing or exhibiting such motion.
